required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Split-face Study of Photodynamic Therapy With St. John's Wort Versus Indole-3-acetic Acid for the Treatment of Acne

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aimed to evaluated the efficacy and safety of SJW-PDT compared to indole-3-acetic acid (IAA)-PDT in the treatment of acne. The investigators also investigated the skin rejuvenating effects of SJW-PDT.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: a double-blind split-face randomized controlled design

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 and 4 weeks after the last treatment
primary_outcome.description: change in the number of acne lesions after the treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 and 4 weeks after the last treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Sebum secretion rate was measured with Sebumeter SM 815®.

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 and 4 weeks after the last treatment
other_outcome.description: The erythema index (EI) was measured with Mexameter MX 1® (Courage & Khazaka)

other_outcome.time_frame: 1 and 4 weeks after the last treatment
other_outcome.description: The skin texture and wrinkles were measured with an Antera 3D® camera (Miravex Limited, Dublin, Ireland).

arm_group.description: Participants were randomized to receive either the SJW extract or IAA on each split-face. The SJW extract (DR-Light complexTM; Genicos Co., Ltd, Cheongju, Korea) consisted of 70% 1, 3-butylene glycol, and 0.1% hypericin as active ingredients. After cleansing the face gently, participants applied 1.5 ml of 0.5% SJW extract on one half of the face and 1.5 ml of 0.015% IAA (AC gel®; Wellskin, Seoul, Korea) on the other half of the face for 10 minutes under occlusion.

Participants were randomized to receive either the SJW extract or IAA on each split-face. The SJW extract (DR-Light complexTM; Genicos Co., Ltd, Cheongju, Korea) consisted of 70% 1, 3-butylene glycol, and 0.1% hypericin as active ingredients. After cleansing the face gently, participants applied 1.5 ml of 0.5% SJW extract on one half of the face and 1.5 ml of 0.015% IAA (AC gel®; Wellskin, Seoul, Korea) on the other half of the face for 10 minutes under occlusion.

intervention.description: A 630 nm red light and a 520 nm green light of the light-emitting diode (LED) device (Nouvo-GB®) with an intensity of 35 mW⁄cm2 was simultaneously illuminated for 10 minutes (a total light dose of 21 J/cm2). Participants received a total of four treatments at 1-week intervals and were followed up 1 and 4 weeks after the last treatment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with mild to moderate facial acne
- between 25 and 60 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of oral retinoid treatment with the past 6 months
- history of oral antibiotics, topical acne treatment, or skin rejuvenation treatment such as lasers and chemical peeling within the month before the start of the study
